result.execSummary:
The defendant Marwan Y Atshan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

miscConds.notes:
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.

-No contact with firearms.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment".
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention OR Anger Management and continued programming.

-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.

timeConds.notes: -Serve 25 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 3-11-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marwan Y Atshan

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marwan Y Atshan in court.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Marwan Y Atshan in court with attorney Munjed A. Ahmad.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.  Additional statement by Vivial A.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction,  with credit for 0 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 25 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 3-11-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention OR Anger Management and continued programming.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment".
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Marwan Y Atshan in court with attorney Munjed A. Ahmad.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 38/  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Marwan Y Atshan in court with attorney Munjed A. Ahmad.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State has sent a letter to the victim to inform of possible DPA.  Case is adjourned to 11-9-2015.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Marwan Y Atshan in court with attorney Munjed A. Ahmad.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is to be reviewed by ADA Peter Tempelis for a DPA.  Case set for DPA on 10-27-2015.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with V.M.A. dob 3-4-1974, F.A. dob unknown who witnessed incident.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Marwan Y Atshan in court with attorney Munjed A. Ahmad.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 38.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Marwan Y Atshan
Current: 855 W Layton Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53221   (Effective: 09-14-2015)
Prior: 2018 West Oakwood Road, Oak Creek, WI 53154
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 9-14-15 @ 1:30 pm
